Reviews.Title: Good phone for the price
Reviews.Author: Jenny Lawrance
Reviews.Content: Lg E900 Windows 7 Black Unlocked 16GB HD CAMERA 5MP Optimus 7I purchased this phone through HassleFreeCell a month ago. This is a review of the overall experience and not just of the phone.1. Seller: Excellant. Ordered the phone a thurday, and phone reached on Saturday (all the way to west coast from NY). That was prety impressive.2. Using phone with ATT. I had a prepaid ATT connection, and my exisintg SIM which worked on a feature phone wasn't detected by the new phone. (The sim had a gophone label on it). Initially, I thought this was because of a hardware problem in the LG optimus, and got in touch with the customer service at Hasslefree who confirmed that the phone was indeed unlocked. Meanwhile, at work, I tried one of my friend's SIM card, and it was detected by the phone. Long story short, I went to an ATT store, and get a new prepaid SIM, which was detected.Since I was keen on not using a data plan, I was able to turn off ATT's data connection on the phone, and so far, the phone hasn't sent out any data packets on the wire through ATT network (saving me money).Meanwhile, the phone was setup to use the WIFI at home and work, and data transfers over WIFI work seemlessly. Main usage - browsing and outlook sync.3. Voice quality: It works. Nothing great or nothing terribly bad about it.4. Package: Everything in the box was in sealed plastic covers except for the headphones which was in a tiny zip lock bag. One of the in-ear buds looked used as well. I'm not sure whom to blame for this. Anyways, there were additional ear buds of smaller size which fits my ear, I chose to ignore this issue.5. Phone Restarts while plugging in the head-phone / car audio connector. This by far has been my major issue with the phone. I'd planned to use my phone as a proper Mp3 player to take along while running, but this defect has terribly hindered the plan. The issue happens randomly, and my guess is that something is getting shorted  when the audio jack is inserted in the device causing it to restart.6. OS:  Coming from a feature phone background, it took a little while to get used to a new smartphone OS. Changing to speaker phone was a direct option in the screen in my old phone, but in Win Phone 7 OS, It needs two clicks (since the menu is hidden by default). It took some time as well to figure this out, since this menu is visible only when a call is on (expected), but the focus while calling is to talk, and not to figure out the phone controls. ==> New V1 OS, so not everything is intuitive.Summary:I got what I paid for ( 275$  for a smartphone is not too bad ). However, I doubt whether the phone will last 3 years. (My old LG feature phone is still working well even after 3 years of rough use, being dropped many times etc).I like the fact that I can check my office exchange E-mails via outlook (when I'm at home), This is something which works well all the time. Calender and mails were the main reasons I got a smartphone, and these two works reliably.Battery Life: I still haven't able to judge how long the battery last, sometimes a day, sometimes 3 days, and the usage patters were pretty similar all the time. This is something which I need to figure out.Responsive UI. The reason why I didn't pick an unlocked Nokia was this. The phone has decent procesor and built memory (both RAM and disk space) So, its very responsive while switching from one application to other.Other Hardware: Flaky. Connecting ear phone is the worst thing you can do to this phone. Volume automatically goes down to 0, phone restarts, etc happen in my phone when the ear phone is plugged in.WIFI: good. Even though either the OS or firmware has a weirdness when it connects to wifi. It refuses to connect to the wireless router if the internet connection is unavailable, and gives an unhelpful error code saying password is incorrect. All the other wireless devices connect just fine, yes, we're unable to browse, which is expected, but this phone does something beyond just connecting to router.I've never used a Iphone or android, so I cant compare this with the other phones in the league.

Reviews.Title: Best WP7 phone
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time looking at the different WP7 phones out there before taking the jump, and I'm really happy that I chose this one. The phone has a solid, sleek build about it that makes it stand out from the other wp7 phones -- in particular the other phone that had caught my attention was the Samsung Focus, but it had a cheap, plasticky feel that made me lean towards the Optimus 7. I think the 3.8" screen is just the right size and it feels very good in the hand. The screen is NOT AMOLED, but on putting this phone side-by-side with the Focus I actually preferred the colours on the Optimus 7, with the one downside being that the black on the Focus was darker.I was very impressed by the WP7 UI which is very sleek and very user-friendly, and is a step above the iOS and Android at least in terms of look and feel. There are some downsides: it's somewhat difficult to search the marketplace for specific apps directly on the phone (I prefer to do that on the Zune on the PC; the NoDo update later this month is supposed to fix this), and there are fewer apps out there than for the other two platforms. An omission was that from the settings panel the phone's MAC address wasn't listed and I had to do a web search to uncover a hidden engineering panel from which this could be retrieved (so that I could put the phone on my university wifi).Also LG gives users 60-days of free app downloads from the LG store and they do have some good apps, so that was definitely a bonus. The camera itself was solid but there's not particularly many settings and it's a bit grainy indoors.This LG phone was very nice for me and I recommend it to others. I found the review at endgadget particularly good:[...]

Reviews.Content: I love my windows 7.8 phone. I use it in teaching (attendance, checking and recording grades, writing documents, etc.), fun, travel, and just about everything else.  It's light, sharp looking, great screen, and the live tiles are tremendous.If you want a good camera, however, get a different phone.I would buy this phone again and would recommend it to anyone who does not want to buy a Windows 8 phone because of the cost.

Reviews.Title: Decent phone for the price, great choice if you absolutely need a Windows phone
Reviews.Author: JustAnotherCustomer
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these a year and a half ago when my employer launched a program reimbursing us for Windows 7 phones (if I had a choice, I would definitely go with Android, but what the hell..) and this was the cheapest WP7 phone available then. The 2 phones have changed 4 hands in the last one and a half years, so I am speaking for all the users.I would give it 3 stars - cutting one for the poor quality screen that broke on a single drop and one for crappy Windows 7 software.* Overall - great phone for the price, screen is quite smooth and responsive, the hardware is reasonably sturdy and looks impressive unlike some cheap phones out there with tacky plastic. The camera is quite decent. A friend tells me the Windows 7 app store is very comprehensive, so he doesn't miss anything with this phone.* Software - Windows 7 for phones has a ton of issues. You can't delete contacts in groups/bulk, so if you sync your device often, you end up with a terribly bloated contacts book and the only way to delete contacts is ONE BY ONE. Several other such small but annoying software issues- though over the last year, the updates sent out by Microsoft have made it slightly better to use. Don't even get me started about the stupid idea of needing Zune installed on every PC that you need to sync the phone with. :(* TMobile issues- as another user pointed out, multimedia messages don't work with TMobile on this. The folks at the local store I went to didn't seem to recognize this model at all.* Works with regular simcards - these phones were used for the large part in India/USA and they work well with all SIM cards in India.* Screen - The screen on one of the phones smashed after a friend dropped it once. The touchscreen was still functional, so my friend continued to use it with the cracked screen.

Reviews.Title: LG Optimus
Reviews.Author: Carl Gussgard "cgussgard"
Reviews.Content: Good value phone.  Really like Windows 7 phone tiles.  Had it for over a month and works like a charm.

Reviews.Title: Awesome cellphone
Reviews.Author: Vecastone
Reviews.Content: Awesome cellphone. Arrived on time and the package was perfect. The size is perfect also, not that big as an iphone and not as small to be forgotten anywhere. The screen size also is more than enough, to write messages and to see pictures. The touch screen/feature smooth and very sensitive. I've tried other cellphones and you have to punch the screen in order to make it work. This is not the case. Zoom out and in feature works perfectly. Loved the maps and the way you can rearrange all the boxes in the screen with the different features. Awesome sound not only in the phone but also with the headphones. Picture quality and video quality are amazing.On the con side, I must say I haven't been able to download any application since apparently they are not 'open' for my country. Cannot understand how that happen even for the free applications. Another con is that the alarm doesn't work if the cellphone has been turned off. If this can be configured, please let me know how. Also if you know how to make the sound warning when receiving a message repetitive, I'd appreciate it. I haven't been able to attach a word document to an sms message, only pictures.One last thing, I had to reboot the phone because i didn't know that the first email account that you sync cannot be deleted and I used an old one. Not that funny! since I had to load all my contacts again and set all the configurations.Overall this is a great cellphone, I'm still learning all the things that it has but I'd love to be able to download more applications and understand why certain configurations are so basic when more simple cellphones have more options.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Butterflyy81 "-butterflyy81-"
Reviews.Content: The LG Optimus 7 is a good solid phone.  It is a little heavy so you might want to get a light weight case for it.  But it feels strong and solid in your hand and you know it will not break if you drop it.  It has a great battery life.. I talk on it a lot, download work docs, check email, play games.  It has to be charged every night for heavy usage.  The camera is pretty good for a camera phone and the built in GPS is useful.  I love the Smartshare feature which has guided me to the nearest Starbucks many times! But this feature will find local hospitals, restaurants, pharmacies or whatever you might need.  I use the phone with T-mobile and you might have to do some googling at first in order to get into the MFG setting to set up the phone for internet and to send and receive pics.  Other than the somewhat tedious set up process, I love this phone.  I've had it for almost a year and it is quite convenient.  The screen resolution is awesome, the endless apps are fantastic and the fact that it runs microsoft office and adobe is priceless.  I have had two other LG touchscreen phones and I have to say this one is the most sturdy.  The other two only lasted for two years each before beginning to have random issues with the touchscreen.  Based on how the Optimus 7 is built and the performance, I think this one may last a little longer!

Reviews.Title: this LG E900 phone and WindowsPhone 7 are amazing !
Reviews.Author: willie cima
Reviews.Content: Estoy encantado con este equipo, es realmente excelente, la construcción metálica es muy buena, no es un juguete como lucen otros celulares, no sabía que LG fabricaba esta calidad de equipos.Lo uso en Argentina hace un par de semanas y cada dia me sorprende mas, la conectividad con wi fi es de lo mejor que he visto, solo el Nokia N8 es tan eficiente en este sentido.También me ha sorprendido la cantidad de aplicaciones que he podido bajar, no se por qué han comentado que este sistema operativo tiene pocas aplicaciones, estuve dos horas mirando y bajando aplicaciones ! por supuesto que como en cualquier equipo muchas son inútiles o tonterias, pero algunas son excelentes, no recuerdo haber encontrado tanto en Android.Debo decir también que ayer conecté el equipo a la computadora y me encontré con la grata sorpresa de que estaba disponible la version 7.5 Mango y pude instalarla sin ningún problema, aunque advierto a quien quiera hacerlo que debe tener paciencia porque demora mucho, más de lo que uno se imagina, un par de veces dudé si estaba trabajando o se había colgado, pero es así, hay que dejarlo y el proceso se completa perfectamente.La pantalla del LG E900 es excelente, es un placer reproducir fotos y videos o ver YouTube para lo cual supongo que debe tener un procesador muy rápido porque no tiene demoras.Con esta versión 7.5 ahora se puede incorporar tonos de llamadas de mp3 o wma, pero no es tan fácil como en Android que se hace directamente con el equipo sino que hay que preparar antes el archivo, conectarse en la compu al Zune, en fin, algo complicado pero se puede hacer, en la version 7 no se podía, tal vez deban simplificar esto en el futuro.También debo decir que este sistema operativo WindowsPhone 7.5 cada vez me gusta mas, al principio parecepoco "divertido" si uno lo compara con el Android o el del iPhone, pero a medida que se usa se aprecia la increible claridad y facilidad de uso del sistema, el diseño gráfico es perfecto, limpio, moderno, se nota un gran estudio de diseño gráfico atrás de esto.Volviendo al equipo hay que destacar la calidad de la pantalla del LG 900 de 3.7', el multi touch es comparable al iPhone sin ninguna duda, una maravilla, algo que no sucede en el famoso Nokia N8 cuyo touch deja mucho que desear (hago esta comparación porque también tengo el N8, es muy bueno pero prefiero el LG, sorry Nokia pero ya no saben que hacer con ese Symbian por mas que lo decoren es antiguo, claro que si a usted le gusta el Symbian el hardware del N8 es maravilloso, y la cámara lo mejor que se ha creado en celulares tanto para fotos como para filmar es increible, y creo que puedo opinar porque soy fotógrafo y jamás me han interesado las camaritas de los celulares hasta que conocí este Nokia N8, pero, el Symbian... uff, felicito a Nokia por la decisión de adoptar WindowsPhone en sus nuevos equipos, nadie duda de la calidad de Nokia pero vienen patinando hace tiempo con el viejo sistema operativo).En cuanto a la cámara del LG es de 5Mp  y no la he probado demasiado, creo que anda muy bién y es muy fácil de configurar, cambiar el formato, etc., pero no puedo opinar mucho aún.Finalmente hay que destacar que este LG tiene muy buén precio en relación a su tremenda calidad, y hablando de esto menciono que no tuve ningún problema con esta compra en Amazon y WirelessEverything, el envio super rápido y free !

Reviews.Title: Muy buen teléfono. excelente

Reviews.Content: Recién compre este teléfono, y me parece que es lo maximo y por mucho el mejor telefono que eh probado y tenido... no tiene problema alguno, no se queda pegano ni se reinicia,.los juegos se ven excelente de una calidad igual a la de un iphon o android y a mucho menos costo ademas posee office puedes crear documentos en word y excel directamente desde el teléfono ademas de visualizar powertpoint y a su vez modificaros... el programa zune es lo maximo tiene un desempeño increíble ademas de poseer 16gigas de memoria. la pantalla es muy buena y nítida, y la cámara ademas de tomar las fotos muy bien graba video en 720p HD muy buenos.en un futuro el celular recibirá una actualización muy importante q se hace llamar mango la cual supondrá una enorme cantidad de mejoras en velocidad y tiempos de cargas ademas de otras cosas que harán de este teléfono la digna competencia contra android y iphone, por cierto el procesador de este celular es de 1.2ghz una velocidad mas que suficiente para exigirle al teléfono lo que sea. sin duda la mejor adquisición que eh hecho hasta los momentos.por cierto quisiera comentar que soy venezolano y aqui funciona con la red de todas las operadoras y el 3g de todas también,  yo soy usuario de MOVILNET y estoy muy complacido el 3g es permanente y muy rápido.

Reviews.Title: A great Hardware, Operating System Very Frustrating
Reviews.Author: Patricio Alvarez Pimentel "A conscious customer"
Reviews.Content: Hi!This phone is really nice, the screen very clear, the wi-fi reception excellent, really fast, the telephone has a GPS receptor and gyroscope, 16 Gb of RAM, power supply and charge from USB, just to mention some characteristics but...Windows phone 7 is a new concept in Microsoft Phone OS but from my point of view it is an unfinished product may be put on sale too early may be in the future will be great as were previous versions. I have had several windows based PDAs and Phones and I was more than happy with them but this new one...Well.....  At the moment I have identified the following in just a week of use:1. As boxed it has not cut, copy and paste functions!!!!! Can you believe it? The good news is once you update the software you can have copy and paste (but not cut)2. If you want to pass a document (Power point, Excel, Word or just text)  from your phone to your pc or back you must have a online connection and use either an e mail, a SharePoint or use his service named SkyDrive  pass it to the site and then download to your phone!!!.... No direct connection via USB for this propose is possible.3. Music, Photos, Or video can be moved from your PC using Zune software using the USB port putting the files in specific folders4. You just can copy contacts FROM your SIM but not TO the SIM so you cannot come back to a regular phone if you want, not without invest some hours recapturing your contacts manually.5. Talking about contacts you should be online again to copy/sync contacts to or from your phone to an e-mail service like Hot mail (of course) upload your contacts there and then download it from or to your phone.6. The GPS as is just can be used with Bing Maps (one more time online) is not possible use GPS offline since does not has maps stored in the phone, you cannot even have the basic service you can expect from a GPS Coordinates and compass. The good news in his "market place" there are several options of GPS decent software that you can buy by something between $15 to $45 dollars.7. You cannot install software to your phone in other way than using his "market place" (this is frustrating) of course the idea is to concentrate the selling of software for the OS to Microsoft (good for them, less freedom for you) fortunately the amount of software available is growing.8. The OS at this moment do not have support to SD cards or similar.9. Good news for the LG customers, in the "Market Place" there are several interesting an FREE tools you can put to your LG phone, they are tiny but very useful.10. You don't have the freedom of put your custom sounds or music for the ring tone, and some other similar restrictions not critical but nice to have.The bottom-line: The Hardware simply is excellent (just no external memory but for most applications the memory included is enough) , This version of windows phone is very fast and simple but has a lot of restrictions some may be due to a too early release other probably because the commercial strategy that Microsoft has decided to take. I hope future updates can make the operating system a more enjoyable experience and providing more freedom and options to user. If you like to have a expensive, nice, easy to use and vey restricted phone then you must buy a Windows Phone 7, If you like to buy phones to crack them and install new operating systems this telephone is great!. If you are a Windows fan like me keep yourself in that way, be happy look for a Windows Mobile 6 phone there are several excellent in Amazon cheaper than ever or simply wait some time for a better version of Windows phone.

Reviews.Author: giokvara
Reviews.Content: Hi, i purchased this phone and it is piece of crap, it overheats and restarts by itself, doesn't boot properly and screen gets stuck at LG logo, whatever i tried doesn't work it cools downs some time after and works for 5 minutes then shuts down and gets stuck again, I sent them seller two emails about the issue and they dont answer, since I'm not in US I don't know what to do... do NOT buy this phone, 2 weeks of waiting and dissapointment

Reviews.Title: Muy buen equipo aunque con algunos detalles mejorables
Reviews.Author: 3vils33d
Reviews.Content: El equipo es realmente atractivo y bastante delgado.Buen tamaño de pantallaAun no se que tanto le dura la bateria puesto que no lo he usado lo suficiente como para decir si es buena.Las personas que compren este equipo deben comprarse unos audifonos pues en lo particular no me gustan nada los que trae.El sistema operativo por otra parte, me ha encantado. Muy fluido, bastante intuitivo. Sencillo pero util. Muchas aplicaciones gratis o pagas.En espera del nuevo Firmware MANGO, para ver las nuevas mejoras e integraciones.No me ha desilucionado en nada. El touch de la pantalla es excelente, sumamente correcto y exacto, mas de lo q esperaba.Aun no he probado el Android pero no dudo que Windows Phone puede llegar hacer mas que un exitazo.Se los recomiendo con total seguridad.
